details.title: Amid high security, counting to begin at 8 AM
details.content:
Haryana Police has made full proof three-tier security arrangement for the safety of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) and Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT), said Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) (Law and Order).

Around 90 strong rooms have been established at 59 different locations with a round-the-clock vigil to ensure the safety of EVMs and VVPAT machines.

details.title: Security beefed up outside counting booths in Jind
JJP will hold key to forming government in Haryana, claims Prateek Som
details.content:
Jannayak Janata Party (JJP) spokesperson Prateek Som claimed that his party will hold the key to forming the new government in Haryana. "My party has always claimed that we will hold the key to forming the government in Haryana. This time, Haryana has gone for silent voting. People were not very vocal about their choices," Som said.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.content:
Times Now

  • BJP-71
  • Cong-11
  • INLD+Akali-0
  • Others-8

India News-Polstrat

  • BJP-75-80
  • Cong-9-12
  • INLD+Akali-0-1
  • Others-1-3

News X-Polstrat

  • BJP-75-80
  • Cong-9-12
  • INLD-Akali-0-1
  • Others-1-3

details.title: A confident Babita Phogat predicts her victory
details.content:
Wrestler Babita Phogat, BJP's candidate for Dadri assembly constituency: People have given me love and support, that is my strength, & what keeps me going. I have faith in public and myself, people will give blessings to their daughter. #HaryanaAssemblyPolls pic.twitter.com/y3DMGvJGbD

— ANI (@ANI) October 24, 2019

details.title: Leads from postal ballots show BJP leading in three seats
JPP will form government in Haryana: Dushyant Chautala
details.content:
Dushyant Chautala: Na BJP, na Congress 40 par karegi, satta ki chabi JJP (Jannayak Janata Party) ke haath mein hogi. #HaryanaAssemblyPolls pic.twitter.com/qvYAVvKl7Y

— ANI (@ANI) October 24, 2019

details.title: JJP takes lead in three seats
details.content: Dushyant Chautala's JJP is now leading in three seats.

details.title: BJP star candidates take the lead
details.content: Wrestler turned BJP candidate Yogeshwar Dutt and Babita Phogat leading in Baroda and Charkhi Dadri.

details.title: Counting of ballots underway
details.content:
#HaryanaAssemblyElections2019: Counting of votes underway in Karnal. pic.twitter.com/CS9c4eBvAa

— ANI (@ANI) October 24, 2019

details.title: Manohar Lal Khattar, Bhupinder Singh Hooda lead in early trends
details.content: Haryana had on Monday recorded a voter turnout of over 68 per cent, a sharp decline from 76.54 in the 2014 assembly polls.

details.title: Counting underway in Gurugram
details.content:
#HaryanaAssemblyElections2019: Counting of votes underway in Gurugram. pic.twitter.com/kAhCf1IZQL

— ANI (@ANI) October 24, 2019

details.title: Key candidates across the political spectrum take lead
details.content:
Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar leading from Karnal and Former Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda leading from Garhi Sampla-Kiloli assembly seat in Rohtak.

Dushyant Chautala of JJP is leading from Uchana Kalan constituency.

details.title: Ex-CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda says Congress will form the next govt
details.content:
#WATCH Senior Congress leader & former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda in Rohtak: Congress ka bahumat aayega. #HaryanaAssemblyPolls pic.twitter.com/dxzdQNY09c

— ANI (@ANI) October 24, 2019

details.title: BJP takes lead in 29 seats, Congress in 21
details.content: According to official trends from EC, Bharatiya Janata Party-29 & Indian National Congress -21, Jannayak Janta Party-10 & Others-9; Total 90 seats.

details.title: Dushyant Chautala to the kingmaker in Haryana?
details.content:
As per TV reports, BJP has asked SAD leaders Parkash Singh Badal and Sukhbir Badal to reach out to JJP's Dushyant Chautala.

As per initial trends of all 90 assembly seats, BJP is leading in 38 seats, Congress in 32. Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) leading in 11 seats, Indian National Lok Dal leading in 2 seats.

details.title: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala leading from Kaithal seat.
After BJP, Congress tries to reach out to Chautala
details.content: As the numbers predict a hung situation in Haryana, the Congress is now trying to reach out to Dushyant Chautala, who is emerging as the possible kingmaker. As per TV reports, Congress could offer the Deputy CM post to Chautala.

details.title: Amit Shah summons Manohar Lal Khattar to BJP headquarters at 2 pm
details.content: Home Minister Amit Shah has cancelled his ITBP function in Greater Noida and has summoned Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar to the BJP headquarters in Delhi at 2 pm on Thursday.

details.title: Will support anyone who offers CM's chair: Dushyant Chautala
details.content: JJP chief Dushyant Chautala on Thursday said that he will extend his support to anyone offering him the chief minister's chair.

details.title: Election officials carry out counting of votes for Haryana Assembly election results.
details.content: (Photo| PTI)

details.title: Surjewala trailing from Kaithal
details.content: Now, Congress' Randeep Surjewala is trailing from Kaithal

details.title: Haryana ready to embrace new dawn of justice & equality under Congress: Kumari Selja
details.content:
Haryana has given the verdict- it will not tolerate @BJP4Haryana's misgovernance any more.Choosing to leave behind the maladies inflicted on its people in last 5years,the state is ready to embrace a new dawn of justice &equality under the leadership of @INCHaryana.#IbbkeCongress

— Kumari Selja (@kumari_selja) October 24, 2019

details.title: Sonia Gandhi dials Hooda, gives a free hand on govt formation
details.content: As per TV reports, Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi has given former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda a free hand on government formation in Haryana.

details.title: Dushyant Chautala is leading by 18,445 from Uchana Kalan
Nascent JJP emerges key player as BJP loses grip in rural Haryana
details.content:
The trends of the vote count in Haryana on Thursday indicate that the ruling BJP's hardliner nationalistic agenda vis-a-vis Article 370 did not help much in rural areas as the party seemed to have lost ground in as many as 17 seats in interior parts.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: Seven ministers, Assembly Speaker, state BJP chief trailing in Haryana
details.content:
Congress gains momentum as seven ministers from Khattar's Cabinet, Assembly Speaker, state BJP chief trail in Haryana.

(CLICK HERE TO READ MORE)

details.title: Decision after final numbers: Dushyant Chautala
details.content: Dushyant Chautala says, he did not hold any discussions with parties. "Decision will be taken only after the final numbers are out," he added.

details.content:
#HaryanaAssemblyElections2019: Bharatiya Janata Party's Babita Phogat leading with a margin of 2387 votes in Dadri assembly constituency (file pic) pic.twitter.com/OMxNd45AKE

details.title: Bhupinder Singh Hooda to address presser around 1 pm
details.content: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda to address a press conference around 1pm.

details.title: JP Nadda reaches BJP headquarters
details.content: BJP working president JP Nadda has reached the BJP headquarters in Delhi to chair a meeting with Haryana BJP in-charge Anil Jain.

details.title: BJP chief in Haryana Subhash Barala resigns
details.content: BJP chief in Haryana Subhash Barala has resigned from his post. Barala is trailing from Tohana.

details.title: It's neck-and-neck in Haryana
Fight intensifies in Haryana
details.content: Both the BJP and Congress are now leading  in 35 seats intensifying the fight.

details.title: Hooda asks JJP, INLD for form government with Congress in Haryana
details.content: BS Hooda in Rohtak: : The time has come for Congress, JJP, INLD, and independents to come together to form a strong government. I assure that each one will be respected and given a respectable position.

details.title: JJP registers first win
Manohar Lal Khattar reaches Delhi
details.content: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has reached Delhi. He has been summoned by Home Minister Amit Shah.

details.title: First defeat for Congress in Haryana as Randeep Singh Surjewala loses Kaithal seat
details.content: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala has lost the Kaithal seat to BJP’s Leela Ram by 567 votes.

details.title: TikTok star and BJP candidate Sonali Phogat has lost from Adanpur
I want to ask Dushyant Chautala, independent candidates to form coalition govt: DS Hooda
details.content: Congress leader DS Hooda: Today, it’s clear that people’s mandate is to throw off Khattar’s govt. I want to ask Dushyant Chautala (JJP), independent candidates & other parties to come together&form coalition govt in Haryana so that people’s mandate can be respected.

details.title: Minister Krishan Kumar Bedi loses
details.content: Minister Krishan Kumar Bedi lost to JJP's Ram Karan from the Shahbad by a margin of 37,127 votes.

• Olympian Sandeep Singh of BJP defeats Congress' Mandeep Chatha from Pehowa.
  • Kuldeep Vatsa of Congress defeats Agriculture Minister OP Dhankar Pardeep Chaudhary in Badli.

details.title: JJP to call for a meeting tomorrow: Chautala
details.content: JJP leader Dushyant Chautala said that the party would meet in Delhi at 11 AM. "After selecting the leader for legislative leadership, we would keep the perspective in front of the national executive," he added.

details.title: Manohar Lal Khattar inches closer to victory
details.content: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar is leading in Karnal assembly seat by 41,950 votes. Congress' Tarlochan Singh is trailing.

details.title: Subhash Barala says he has not resigned
details.content: BJP's state chief Subhash Barala says that he has not resigned from his post.

details.title: BJP party spokesman Shahnawaz Hussain at BJP headquarter
details.content: (Photo| Express)

details.title: As of 4 PM BJP is leading in 39 and Congress in 32 seats
Modi, Shah to chair emergency party meet
details.content: PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah will meet and address the party workers at the BJP headquarters this evening.

details.title: Bhupinder Singh Hooda, son likely to meet Sonia Gandhi in Delhi
details.content: As per TV reports, Congress leaders BS Hooda and his son Deepender Hooda are about to leave for Delhi to meet Sonia Gandhi.

details.title: Wrestler-turned-politician Babita Phogat loses from Dadri
Happy with Haryana and Maharashtra trends: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra
details.content:
#WATCH: Congress General Secretary for UP (East) Priyanka Gandhi Vadra in Raebareli says, "I haven't seen the latest trends, really happy at both (Haryana and Maharashtra). We also are happy about the fact that here in UP our vote percentage has increased." pic.twitter.com/WICkvwnUqd

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) October 24, 2019

details.title: Khattar to stake claim to form governmnet
details.content:
As of 5.15 PM, that BJP has won 21 seats and is leading in 19 other seats which takes the tally to 40. However, the BJP is short of six seats to cross the halfway mark. 

In the wake of the recent developments, CM Manohar Lal Khattar is likely to meet the Haryana Governor and stake claim to form government.

details.title: Bhupinder Singh Hooda wins by huge margin
details.content: Former Haryana chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda has defeated the BJP candidate Satish Nandal.

details.title: CM Khattar is likely to meet Haryana Governor this evening
Dushyant Chautala will be next Haryana CM: Congress' Ashok Tanwar
details.content:
Jannayak Janata Party (JJP) chief Dushyant Chautala will be the next chief minister of Haryana, former state Congress chief Ashok

Tanwar said on Thursday, even as the counting of votes is underway. Speaking to ANI here, Tanwar said the people of Haryana have rejected the BJP and the Congress and asked the two parties to support Chautala become the chief minister.

details.title: Amit Shah tweets in Hindi, says thank you to people of Haryana
details.content:
गत 5वर्षों में मोदी जी के केंद्रीय नेतृत्व में खट्टर सरकार ने हरियाणा की जनता के कल्याण के लिए हर संभव प्रयास किये।
भाजपा को सबसे बड़ी पार्टी बनाकर पुनः सेवा का मौका देने के लिए जनता का अभिनंदन करता हूँ।

मुख्यमंत्री श्री @mlkhattar, श्री @subhashbrala व सभी कार्यकर्ताओं को बधाई।

— Amit Shah (@AmitShah) October 24, 2019

details.title: Thank the people of Haryana for blessing us: PM Modi
details.content: PM Narendrav Modi: I thank the people of Haryana for blessing us. We will continue to work with same zeal and dedication for the state’s progress. I laud the efforts of hardworking BJP Haryana karyakartas who toiled extensively and went amongst people to elaborate on our development agenda.

details.title: BJP top leadership arrive at party headquarters in Delhi
details.content:
Delhi: Union Home Minister and BJP National President, Amit Shah, and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh arrive at party headquarters. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and party leader JP Nadda also present. pic.twitter.com/lSUfREURWp

— ANI (@ANI) October 24, 2019

details.title: It's a moral defeat for BJP: Anand Sharma
details.content: "We accept the people's mandate humbly and respectfully. We also want to say that it is a moral defeat for the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). PM Narendra Modi, BJP president Amit Shah and their entire leadership was cut off from the ground reality," says Congress leader Anand Sharma.

details.title: Shah puts positive spin on Haryana outcome
details.content: Addressing workers at the party headquarters, Amit Shah said the BJP had seen seen a 3% increase in its vote share in Haryana since the last elections and has emerged as the largest party there.

details.title: Ex-Haryana Minister Gopal Goyal Kanda to meet Amit Shah as BJP targets independent MLAs
details.content: In Bharatiya Janata Party's attempt to form government in Haryana without Jannayak Janata Party's support, former Haryana minister Gopal Goyal Kanda is scheduled to hold a meeting with BJP president Amit Shah on Thursday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Congress improves tally in Haryana, Maharashtra despite rebellion in ranks
details.content: Ahead of the Assembly elections in Haryana and Maharashtra, the Congress faced a daunting task of keeping its house in order following a number of party workers defecting the party and some openly rebelling against the leadership after the rout in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. (READ MORE)

details.title: Maharashtra, Haryana people have reposed trust in BJP, its chief ministers: PM Narendra Modi
details.content: PM Narendra Modi said that people of Maharashtra and Haryana have reposed their trust in chief ministers of the two states and asserted that they will work even harder in the next five years to serve them. (READ MORE)
